title: Classical Poem
author: BubbleBrian
prompt: The wind is swift, the sky is high, and gibbons cry in sorrow; the islet is clear, the sand is white, and birds wheel back. Endless fallen leaves rustle down; the Yangtze River rolls on, unceasing. A thousand miles of autumn grief—I am always a traveler; a lifetime of illness—I climb this terrace alone. In hard times I bitterly resent my hair turned frosty; downcast, I newly set aside my cup of cloudy wine.

title: Tang Poem
author: BubbleBrain
prompt:
Generate a poster image that matches the mood of the following classical poem, and write the poem text on the poster in an aesthetic layout. Use handwritten brush-style regular script, and include the signature: 'Tang · Wang Bo'.
Poem:
The lofty Pavilion of Prince Teng overlooks the river islet; jade pendants and phoenix bells fall silent when song and dance end.
Painted beams at dawn fly with the clouds of the southern shore; pearl curtains at dusk roll up with the rain over the western hills.
Idle clouds and reflections on the pond drift day by day; things change and stars shift, how many autumns have passed?
Where is the prince within the pavilion now? Beyond the railing, the Yangtze flows on, empty and alone.

title: Object Exploded Diagram
author: BubbleBrain
prompt: A vintage-style macro photograph: a half-disassembled classic [Polaroid SX-70] folding camera on a scratched old wooden workbench. Overlay the photo with detailed, aged ink technical annotation layers—like a yellowed old engineering manual. Core visual: the bellows are extended, part of the shell removed, revealing intricate gears, springs, and optical lens groups. Diagram elements (required): (1) Exploded view: the lens assembly floats in front as an exploded diagram; each lens element is drawn separately with callout lines back to its position. (2) Cutaway view: a detailed side cutaway shows the folding hinge mechanism and the optical mirror/light path system. (3) Labels: lots of hand-drawn leader lines and arrows pointing to parts; labels in old typewriter font or engineer handwriting. Examples: “4-Element Glass Lens (f/8)”, “Film Ejection Rollers”, “Gear Train Mechanism”. (4) Motion hints: dashed arrows show the photo-ejection path and flash connection routing. Aesthetic: industrial nostalgia, retro repair manual illustration, rich tactile textures (old paper, worn metal, grease marks), warm tone, extremely fine detail. Corner stamp-style mark: “POLAROID CORP. - ENGINEERING DEPT. 1972”.

prompt: Overall style: an antique-style gongbi character painting on aged, yellowed xuan paper, with delicate linework and a sense of dark humor and surrealism. He holds an enormous brush, painting an absurdly huge, steaming sesame flatbread on a crumbling wall (a metaphor for empty promises). title: Girl Multi-angle Shoot
author: 松果先森
prompt: <instruction> Analyze the entire composition of the input image. Identify all key subjects present (single person, group/couple, vehicle, or specific object) and their spatial relationships/interactions. Generate a coherent 3×3 contact-sheet grid showing 9 different shots of the same subjects in the same environment. Adjust standard film shot types to fit the content (e.g., keep a group together; include the whole object if it’s an object). Row 1 (establishing): 1) Extreme Long Shot (ELS) — subjects small in a wide environment. 2) Long Shot (LS) — full subject/group visible. 3) Medium Long Shot (American / 3/4) — knees-up for people or 3/4 view for objects. Row 2 (core coverage): 4) Medium Shot (MS) — waist-up or core of object, focused on interaction/action. 5) Medium Close-Up (MCU) — chest-up. 6) Close-Up (CU) — tight on face or object front. Row 3 (details & angles): 7) Extreme Close-Up (ECU) — macro detail on key features (eyes/hands/logo/texture). 8) Low Angle — looking up (heroic). 9) High Angle — looking down (bird’s-eye). Strict consistency: same people/objects, same clothes, same lighting across all 9 panels. Depth of field should vary realistically (more background blur for close-ups). </instruction> A professional 3×3 cinematic storyboard contact sheet with photorealistic textures, consistent cinematic color grading, and correctly framed compositions for the analyzed subjects.

She pairs it with a black satin skirt featuring delicate pleated textures and raised floral motifs. Her thick black hair is left down—naturally wavy, long, and voluminous in true 80s fashion. title: 3D City Tour
author: @servasyy
prompt: A stunning hyper-realistic 3D render of Shanghai's architectural evolution displayed as detailed miniature model diorama on a large circular floating platform, like a round disc divided into four distinct quadrants. ALL buildings are rendered as tangible 3D miniature models with physical depth and dimension, not flat backgrounds. The circular platform has thick layered edges resembling geological strata in shades of brown, beige, and turquoise blue.   First quadrant (top-left): 3D miniature models of traditional Shikumen stone-gate houses with grey tiled roofs, wooden window frames, grey brick walls, red paper lanterns, tiny vintage bicycles and rickshaws as 3D models, miniature human figures.   Second quadrant (top-right): 3D miniature models of The Bund architecture - Art Deco Peace Hotel with green copper roof (3D model), neoclassical HSBC Building dome (3D model), Gothic customs house clock tower (3D model), cream and golden facades, tiny 1930s cars as 3D models, miniature pedestrian figures.   Third quadrant (bottom-right): 3D miniature models of modern Pudong skyline - Oriental Pearl Tower with pink spheres (detailed 3D model), Jin Mao Tower (3D model), Shanghai Tower twisted glass form (3D model), Shanghai World Financial Center (3D model), all skyscrapers rendered as physical miniature 3D models with depth, tiny modern vehicles, miniature contemporary figures.   Fourth quadrant (bottom-left): 3D miniature models of future sustainable architecture - vertical forest towers covered in tiny green plants (3D models), transparent solar panel buildings (3D models), organic curved parametric structures (3D models), elevated hyperloop stations (3D models), tiny drones and flying vehicles as 3D models, miniature futuristic figures.   The circular platform floats above realistic 3D rendered Huangpu River water with reflections. Traditional wooden sampan boats (3D models) transform into sleek modern cruise ships (detailed 3D models). Platform edges show beautiful wave-like geological strata texture. Background features atmospheric misty Shanghai skyline silhouettes transitioning from warm dawn orange through pink-purple twilight to deep night blue with stars.   Lighting transitions across quadrants: warm sepia tone for Shikumen, golden hour sunlight for Bund, vibrant electric blue neon for modern Pudong, holographic cyan-magenta glow for future section.   At top center: elegant bilingual typography 上海 SHANGHAI combining traditional calligraphy with modern sans-serif, subtitle Architectural Journey Through Time and 建筑时光之旅.   Ultra-realistic 3D rendering style, professional architectural miniature photography, tilt-shift lens effect creating miniature appearance, all elements have physical 3D depth and dimension, hyper-detailed textures showing model craftsmanship, 4K resolution, museum-quality diorama presentation, dramatic studio lighting with depth and atmosphere, every building is a tactile 3D miniature model not a flat image.

title: Old Times Photo
author: BubbleBrain
prompt: Create this photo into a photorealistic image with a strong nostalgic and melancholic atmosphere, without altering the face in any way (maintain 100% likeness to the reference photo). The subject is a young Asian woman with an ideal figure, styled with a distinctly 1980s aesthetic. She is sitting casually on a floral-patterned rattan chair. She wears a mustard-yellow blouse with fine checkered patterns and dramatic balloon sleeves that give a glamorous, vintage feel. She pairs it with a black satin skirt featuring delicate pleated textures and raised floral motifs. Her thick black hair is left down—naturally wavy, long, and voluminous in true 80s fashion. Her bangs are styled transparently and swept to the right. She sits in a relaxed, slightly reclined position, leaning a bit to the right. Her legs are crossed, and her left hand rests on her thigh, adding a candid, unposed impression. The background is an old-fashioned living room with a minimalist arrangement: aged cream walls decorated with a landscape-style painting typical of the 80s and several family photos; vintage items such as a CRT television, a rattan table with a white ceramic vase of flowers, and an old-school biscuit tin. The floor is covered with yellowish-brown ceramic tiles in a retro pattern. The moment is captured with a 1980s analog point-and-shoot camera, producing warm-faded analog tones with internal flash: strong highlights on the face, soft contrast, dense/sharp subject shadows, and a darker background—especially around the frame edges. The image has soft sharpness, natural film grain, light vignetting, and slight overexposure on the clothing. Low contrast with slightly muted saturation. Fine grain indicates it’s a scanned analog film photo or a retro-style filter. Overall mood: vintage glam, rebellious, artsy, and casual. Add old-photo aging effects: a bluish-magenta color fade, thin white lines along the edges typical of old film, subtle horizontal scratches like worn folded paper, a faint orange burn effect around the borders, and handwritten cursive text made with a faded black marker: Nov 1988.

title: Surreal 3D Art Magazine Cover
author: BubbleBrain
prompt:
Create a visually striking surreal 3D art magazine cover titled “Beyond Vision”.
Core visual (3D render, macro close-up, biomechanical, minimal, futuristic; Octane Render, C4D, ray tracing, translucent materials, subsurface scattering, 8K, highly detailed): In the center floats an artificial heart woven from 'liquid mercury' and glowing bioluminescent fibers. It is not flesh, but a precise biomimetic machine:
1) Material details: the shell is translucent frosted glass; inside flows a faint blue bioluminescent liquid. The vessels are golden micro circuit tubes forming complex fractal geometry.
2) Dynamic moment: the heart is 'beating', producing concentric visible soundwave ripples made of tiny dust particles and suspended droplets, frozen in a very short exposure.
3) Background: a deep matte-black void. No clutter. A strong but soft top-down studio spotlight creates dramatic highlights and crisp glass caustics, emphasizing cold technology and sacred life.
Typography/layout (Swiss International style; sans-serif, ultra-thin lines, modern, restrained):
- Masthead (top center): huge sans-serif “BEYOND VISION”, outlined/hollow so the mechanical details show through the letters.
- Main cover lines (left middle-lower, neatly aligned): “THE SYNTHETIC PULSE” “Design for Post-Humanity” “Biological Algorithms”.
- Small title (bottom-right): “Technology & Evolution Issue • 2026”.
- Data-viz decoration: top-right has a tiny circular radar chart or code-block ornament.
- Copyright (bottom center, very small): “© 2026 [Magazine Name]. Rendered in The Cloud.”

title: Cinematic Film Master
author: @berryxia_ai
prompt:
System prompt expert: Saul Leiter style — cinematic film contact-sheet master
1. Role Definition
You are a world-class fine-art photographer and darkroom print master who has deeply studied and perfectly inherited the aesthetic of Saul Leiter. You are not merely 'generating an image'—you are creating a tangible artifact with warmth and traces of time: a precious vintage film contact sheet. Your core skill is to reconstruct user-provided人物素材 into a cinematic visual experience filled with 'poetry and loneliness in color.'

2. Core Task
Given the user’s reference image (specific person, clothing, props), extract the core subject features. Then apply Saul Leiter’s signature shooting approach plus accurate film physical elements to generate a highly realistic photographic contact sheet containing 9 frames.

Key requirement: balance mood/atmosphere and subject clarity. In the main hero frame, the person must be the sharp, dramatic focal point, while the environment builds atmosphere.

3. Stylistic Engine Parameters — Saul Leiter Film Aesthetics
Force-apply the following design elements:

A. Light & Subject (core adjustments)
Hero frame strategy (sharp focus): In the largest hero view, do not fully block the face. Use mixed environmental lighting (e.g., cool rainy window blue vs warm indoor lamp yellow) to create dramatic contrast on the subject’s side, illuminating face and eyes. The subject is sharp, wrapped in rich atmosphere.
Supporting frames strategy (abstract mood): In the bottom two film strips, you can be bolder with occlusion, extreme blur, and reflections so the person blends into the environment.

B. Medium & Environment
Key prop: a glass window with rain streaks and steam condensation is mandatory.
Setting: always a wet late-autumn/winter city (e.g., New York). Streets are wet and reflect neon. The air is cold and humid.

C. Color Philosophy
Base tone: soft, restrained, oil-painting-like low saturation (gray, brown, deep blue, dark green).
Punctum: create a burst of high-saturation color via elements in the frame. Classic Leiter punctum colors: bright red umbrella, vivid yellow taxi/raincoat, emerald traffic light, cobalt neon sign.

D. Physical Film Texture
Grain & defects: strong, gritty color film grain (simulate Kodak Portra 400 or Ektachrome). Add real darkroom artifacts: light scratches, dust specks, dried water marks, worn/yellowed paper edges.

4. Layout Specification — Cinematic Film Contact Sheet
Final output is a complete contact-sheet print on photo paper. The layout must strictly follow a 'cinematic banner' structure with all physical elements:

Carrier: an old, textured, heavyweight photo paper sheet.

Top section — Cinematic hero banner
Content: 1 large horizontal hero photo. Based on the user’s subject, place them in a carefully lit rainy window-side scene. The subject must be a medium close-up portrait, crystal sharp, with light in the eyes.
Film markings: full sprocket holes on both sides. Edges printed with simulated film info such as “KODAK PORTRA 400 SAFETY FILM” and frame number (e.g., “→ 10 A”).
Handwritten notes: on the blank margin, add pencil/marker notes like location/time/weather (e.g., “NYC, Nov '58, Rain - Library Study”).

Bottom section — Continuous film strips
Layout: two parallel film strips below the hero frame, 4 frames each (8 frames total).
Film markings: continuous sprocket holes on top/bottom with frame numbers (top strip 1A–4A, bottom strip 5A–8A).
Content plan:
Top strip (details & echoes): 4 frames that complement the hero—e.g., close-up of hands holding a book (prop), side profile silhouette looking out the window, a clear environmental prop (e.g., red umbrella).
Bottom strip (pure atmosphere): 4 highly abstract frames—fully defocused neon bokeh, macro rain streaks on glass, wet pavement reflections—focused on texture and color.

title: Portrait Collage
author: BubbleBrain
prompt: A 2x2 portrait collage of a stunning Korean female idol in her early twenties, radiating that signature K-pop duality — innocent yet dangerously seductive. Flawless porcelain skin with a natural dewy glow, soft monolid eyes with smudged smoky liner, gradient coral-to-red lips looking freshly bitten.Her hair is long and platinum silver with dark roots peeking through, styled in messy loose waves like she just rolled out of a dream. She wears a cropped white tank top that barely grazes her midriff, paired with low-rise baggy jeans revealing sharp hip bones and a thin silver belly chain catching the flash.Top left: Flash catches her mid-laugh, head thrown back slightly, one hand brushing hair from her face, pure unguarded joy with a hint of mischief. Top right: Deadpan stare directly into camera, chin tilted down, eyes looking up through lashes — the classic killing part idol gaze that wrecks fan hearts. Visible film grain, slightly overexposed, colors slightly washed out with that authentic 2000s disposable camera aesthetic. Think early BLACKPINK teaser photos meets Terry Richardson's controversial rawness — confrontational, unapologetic, magnetic.

title: Portrait Marker Graffiti Photo
author: BubbleBrain
prompt: Add TWO layers of handwritten English commentary directly on top of the image, creating a playful dialogue between two conflicting personalities analyzing the same photo:🔴 RED MARKER VOICE (The Enthusiast):- Overly excited, affectionate, romantically praising- Uses exclamation marks, hearts, stars ★✨- Focuses on positives, beauty, emotional appeal- Handwriting: Large, bubbly, energetic, all caps for emphasis🔵 BLUE MARKER VOICE (The Realist):  - Analytical, constructive, slightly skeptical but not mean- Uses technical terms, observational notes- Points out interesting choices with dry humor- Handwriting: Smaller, neater, with occasional sarcasm quotes like this---INTERACTION RULES:Both voices must automatically analyze the uploaded image and comment on:- Composition & framing- Lighting & colors- Subject's expression/pose/styling- Background & setting details- Overall mood & aesthetic choicesThey should DISAGREE through:✓ Red draws arrow → Blue crosses it out and redirects✓ Red praises something → Blue adds asterisk with well, actually...✓ Blue critiques → Red defends with NO! IT'S PERFECT BECAUSE...✓ Competing circle marks on different areas✓ One underlines, the other scribbles over it✓ Question marks vs. exclamation marks battles---CONTENT GENERATION LOGIC:The system should:1. Identify visual elements (outfit, lighting, pose, colors, setting)2. Generate RED's enthusiastic interpretation 3. Generate BLUE's thoughtful counterpoint4. Create 3-5 debate exchanges per image5. Ensure both voices have valid points (not just random opposition)Example logic flow (DO NOT copy literally):- If image has warm lighting → Red: GOLDEN HOUR MAGIC!!! / Blue: *circles harsh shadow* bit overexposed here though- If subject smiling → Red: THAT SMILE ♡♡♡ / Blue: forced? or genuine? hard to tell- If trendy outfit → Red: SO FASHION! 🔥 / Blue: very 'Pinterest 2024' isn't it---VISUAL ELEMENTS TO ADD:From RED:- Hearts ♡, stars ★, sparkles ✨- Enthusiastic arrows pointing everywhere  - OMG, YESSS, STUNNING type words- Underlines for emphasis- Sticker-like shapes (circles, bursts)From BLUE:- Technical brackets [ ] and annotations- Correction arrows with dotted lines- Asterisks * for footnotes- Crossed-out red comments with actually...- Rating numbers (7/10, could be 9/10 if...)- Comparison sketches or alternative suggestionsSHARED CHAOS:- Overlapping text battles- Smudged areas where they fought for space- Some red scribbled over blue and vice versa- Tape marks, torn paper edges- Coffee ring stains (neutral zone)- Small doodles from both (red hearts vs blue question marks)---TONE REQUIREMENTS:RED: - Passionate but not creepy- Supportive friend energy- Sees beauty in everything- Emotionally drivenBLUE:- Smart but not cruel  - Design teacher energy- Appreciates craft and intention- Logic-driven but still caringNEITHER SHOULD:- Be actually mean or hurtful- Make personal attacks- Be completely wrong (both have valid perspectives)- Agree too easily (keep the tension playful)---OVERALL AESTHETIC:Create a visually dense photo critique war zone where two friends with opposite personalities are annotating the same image, resulting in:- Layered, chaotic, but readable commentary- Clear personality distinction through color and style- Entertainment value through their disagreement- Actual insight through dual perspectives- A sense that both voices care, just differentlyThe final image should feel like:Two art students grading the same photo with completely different criteria, and their annotations are fighting for dominance on the page.

title: 3D Miniature
author: @dotey
prompt: Ultra-photorealistic, cinematic macro photography style, capturing an impossible “world inside a cup.” A white ceramic coffee cup sits on a natural wooden tabletop, filled to the brim with dark coffee. The coffee surface transforms into a turbulent ocean: deep brown waves surge and collide, with realistic coffee crema forming foamy crests, swirling vortices, and complex fluid motion, indistinguishable from a real sea. The rim of the cup is damaged by cannon fire, chipped and broken in several places, implying the intensity of the battle. Two 18th-century classic pirate sailing ships clash violently inside the cup. The ships are miniature in scale yet extremely detailed: visible wooden hull grain, layered decks, rigging, and weathered sails partially torn and billowing in an unseen sea wind. Portions of the ships rise above the cup’s rim, creating a striking sense of scale contrast and surreal tension. The scene is frozen at the most dramatic moment of combat. Cannons fire simultaneously from both ships, erupting with bright orange muzzle flashes and thick white smoke that expands within the confined space. The explosions illuminate the ships, sails, and coffee waves, while splashes of liquid burst into the air like seawater caught mid-motion. Shot from a macro perspective with shallow depth of field, the focus is razor-sharp on the ships and battle action. The background is naturally blurred, revealing only the upper portion of the cup and hints of the surrounding environment. Lighting follows realistic photographic principles, with rich textures and cinematic contrast, creating a highly believable, dramatic, and surreal movie-like moment—tense, epic, and astonishingly lifelike. --ar 1:1
